current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To streamline and address overlap in the Federal
		  workforce investment system, steer Federal training dollars toward skills
		  needed by industry, establish incentives for accountability through a Pay for
		  Performance pilot program, and provide new access to the National Directory of
		  New Hires, to measure performance and better connect the unemployed to jobs,
		  and for other purposes.

For
				each Pay for Performance State program, the entity shall evaluate the program
				design and performance on the outcome measures, evaluate (wherever possible)
				the level of satisfaction with the program among employers and employees
				benefiting from the program, and estimate public returns on investment,
				including such returns as reduced dependence on public assistance, reduced
				unemployment, and increased tax revenue paid by participants exiting the
				program for employment.
